[react](/api/react/index.mdx) / Root

# Interface: Root

The default root exported by `@lynx-js/react` for you to render a JSX

## Properties

### ~~registerDataProcessors()~~

```ts
registerDataProcessors: (dataProcessorDefinition: DataProcessorDefinition) => void;
```

Register DataProcessors. You MUST call this before `root.render()`.

#### Parameters

| Parameter                 | Type                                                                          |
| ------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `dataProcessorDefinition` | [`DataProcessorDefinition`](/api/react/Interface.DataProcessorDefinition.mdx) |

#### Returns

`void`

#### Deprecated

use [lynx.registerDataProcessors](/api/react/Interface.Lynx.mdx#registerdataprocessors) instead

#### Defined in

@lynx-js/react/runtime/lib/lynx-api.d.ts:59

---

### render()

```ts
render: (jsx: ReactNode) => void;
```

Use this API to pass in your JSX to render

#### Parameters

| Parameter | Type        |
| --------- | ----------- |
| `jsx`     | `ReactNode` |

#### Returns

`void`

#### Examples

```ts
import { root } from "@lynx-js/react"

function App() {
  // Your app
  return <view>...</view>
}

root.render(<App/>);
```

```tsx
import { root } from '@lynx-js/react';

function App() {
  // Your app
  return <view>...</view>;
}

if (__LEPUS__) {
  root.render(
    <DataProvider data={DEFAULT_DATA}>
      <App />
    </DataProvider>,
  );
} else if (__JS__) {
  fetchData().then((data) => {
    root.render(
      <DataProvider data={data}>
        <App />
      </DataProvider>,
    ); // You can render later after your data is ready
  });
}
```

@lynx-js/react/runtime/lib/lynx-api.d.ts:53
